segments.text: I'm just standing here, watching this whole scene unfold.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's truly a mess, and itâ€™s getting worse every moment.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: How can an adult be so completely out of touch with her surroundings?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is flowing freely, and she's just polishing a plate.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's quite disgusting, really, to see such a disregard for the immediate environment.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The thought of water damage to the cabinets just makes me furious.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: And then there are the children, practically on the verge of falling.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: They are putting themselves in serious danger for a few cookies.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This situation is completely avoidable if anyone paid attention.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I just want to shout and make her look down at her feet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The contrast between her calm, almost serene face and the surrounding chaos is infuriating.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It really makes me question what goes on in people's minds sometimes.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This whole scene feels like a breakdown of basic household awareness.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's a frustrating display of obliviousness and impending accident.
segments.speaker: PAR
